description.text:
Come and meet up with fellow feminists, hear what's coming up within the group and get involved in some interesting discussions.
This month we'll be readying ourselves for future adventures by making a group banner. Come and get hands on or, if crafting isn't your thing, just come for a chat. There will almost certainly also be snacks.
We're a friendly bunch so if you haven't been before but want to come along drop us a line if you have any questions.

name.text: Fawcett East London x Leigh Day: Know Your Worth
name.html: Fawcett East London x Leigh Day: Know Your Worth

description.text:
Why does the gender pay gap persist? What should you do if you’re not being paid equally at work? What is ‘the flinch’?
To find out the answers, join us on 21st May for an evening of practical tips on how to make sure you’re being paid what you’re worth at work.
We’ll have a presentation on the practicalities of challenging equal pay concerns and get advice on how to negotiate your salary. Plus we’ll be raising money to support further campaigning and research while we’re at it.
Get your ticket now, and don’t forget to invite your friends...

Get your ticket now, and don’t forget to invite your friends...

name.text: Fawcett East London x LSE Library : Female leadership stories
name.html: Fawcett East London x LSE Library : Female leadership stories

description.text:
Description
Join Fawcett East London Group for a panel discussion ‘Female Leadership stories: Lean In or Stand Out’, organized in partnership with the LSE Library.  The aim of this conversation is to hear and learn from our panellists, successful female leaders in industries and careers that are traditionally male dominated.
We’ll be joined by Angelique Vu, Software engineer, Founder and Co-chair of FT Women UK, Adizah Tejani, Cofounder and Director of Filanthropy, and Katrina Aleksa, Partner at MTArt Agency, Co-founder at The Association of Women in the Arts, to discuss how women challenge the norm and climb the professional ladder with all the complications along the way; sexism, bullying, harassment, traditionalism, maternity, equal pay within a workforce majority made of men.
The chair for this event will be Sarah Luxford, Director at Global Resourcing & Co-Founder TLA Women in Tech.
There will be a Q&A in the end so you can come forward with any questions or your own experience if you wish to share.
£5 entry cost is a charitable donation to the Fawcett East London Group.
 
Agenda
18:30 - Arrival
19:00 - Panel discussion with Q&A
20:00 – Networking & Exhibition preview 

About the speakers

  
Angelique Vu
Angelique is a software engineer specialised in publishing and content management systems for newsrooms. She has worked at the heart of leading news publishers for over 10 years - with the Financial Times in London and the Australian Financial Review in Sydney. Over the course of her career, she has been a software engineer, project lead, scrum master, art director, and UX designer.
When Angelique first started working in technology, she was surprised at the lack of women in the department. She became passionate about diversity and encouraging more women into STEM areas. Angelique founded FT Women UK at the Financial Times in June 2017 and she is currently co-chair, and she founded and co-chaired Women in Learning and Leadership UK at Pearson in November 2014.

Adizah Tejani
CoFounder and Director - Filanthropy* 
Adizah is a product-focused technology executive having worked within the digital technologies space since 2009. Fast forward to 2019 and she has built a unique lens while working in the global technology sector. She currently works within innovation at HSBC. She was the Director of Marketing EMEA at Token an open banking FinTech company from San Francisco, is a technology Advisor to UCL School of Management and board member of Business France. In 2012 she became the Co-Founder and Company Director of Filanthropy* a supporting grassroots social entrepreneurship projects with small grants.
She has been in the London technology and startup ecosystem for the last 8 years and has worked with a number of industry leaders such as Facebook, Google, Microsoft, IBM, JP Morgan, UBS, Thomson Reuters and Accenture. 
In 2016 Adizah was named one of the top 100 women in London by City A.M and is a judge for the annual CIO awards. In 2017 Adizah was named as one of the Inspiring 50 Europe an annual list of women changing the technology sector across Europe. In 2018 the FT named her as one of the top 100 ethnic minority executives in the UK and USA. 
 
Katrina Aleksa
Katrina is a co-founder of the Association of Women in the Arts (AWITA), the hugely respected non-profit networking group established to advance the careers of women in the visual arts and to promote change in the visual landscape. Katrina sits on the board of a number of Art businesses and organisations ranging from disruptive Art Investment schemes to more traditional Art dealerships.
Born in Latvia, Katrina Aleksa lived, studied and worked in the UK, Italy and Spain by the time she was 20. Katrina has an infectious passion for all things art. Since completing a degree in curating and art business at Sotheby's Institute of Art in London, she has provided Fine Art consultation and brokered Fine Art deals for a number of years. Katrina now travels and consults across the world, particularly with contacts in America, Asia and Australia.
  
Sarah Luxford 
An executive head hunter with a passion for ensuring that the workforce of today reflects our wider society, Sarah encourages her clients to challenge the status quo when they seek new talent, advising both the private and public sector on the power of diversity.
Her work with international tech companies led to co-founding the Tech London Advocates WOMENINTECH group, working with key influencers of the digital community to change the way they think, act and feel towards diversity.
Sarah Luxford is a Director at Executive Search + Talent Development firm Nexec Leaders and a Co-Founder of the community led initiative, Croydon Tech City

Description
Join Fawcett East London Group for a panel discussion ‘Female Leadership stories: Lean In or Stand Out’, organized in partnershi

description.text:
This event is an opportunity to meet friendly fellow activists, discuss feminist issues and learn more about our group, all whilst treating yourself to a delicious Sunday lunch.
A mouthwatering multi-course meal will be served - draft menu below.
Starter - antipastiMain - porchetta with side salad and potatoesDessert - sweet tart with cream
Please let us know if you would like to join and have any dietary requirements.
The venue is in Bow in East London and the full address will be shared nearer the time with those who have booked a place.
Our suggested donation for this event is £15 via Eventbrite, this includes all food and a welcome drink. If you'd like to discuss other options please get in touch via fawcetteastldn@gmail.com

description.text:
This event is an opportunity to meet friendly fellow activists, discuss feminist issues and learn more about our group, all whilst treating yourself to some yummy Italian cuisine in a granary conversion on the Thames.
Dinner will be a multi-course meal, with both seated and standing options. Vegetarian options will be available. If you have any other dietary requirements please let us know before booking. The event is wheelchair accessible from the street to the table.
Timeline:
18:00 - Arrival18:30 - Aperitivo and nibbles19:00 - Dinner and conversation20:30 - Feminist tunes and cake or feminist movie screening (optional)
All food is included, as is a drink on arrival. Our suggested donation for this event is £15 via Eventbrite. If you'd like to discuss other options please get in touch via fawcetteastldn@gmail.com

name.text: Whose responsibility is it to close the gender pay gap?
name.html: Whose responsibility is it to close the gender pay gap?

description.text:
Almost 50 years on from the Equal Pay Act, the gender pay gap in the UK persists, and hasn't changed significantly for years. To mark this year's Equal Pay Day we're hosting a panel discussion to explore the topic of who is responsible for closing the gap.
Join us and a panel of experts from a range of professions to discuss the issue and learn how we can all contribute to bringing about gender pay equality.
More details will be announced as the date approaches but you can be sure it will be a great night with some fascinating discussion. 
Included in the cost of the ticket is a glass of wine or soft drink to be enjoyed after the panel discussion has finished.
description.html:

More details will be announced as the date approaches but you can be sure it will be a great night with some fascinating discussion. 

Included in the cost of the ticket is a glass of wine or soft drink to be enjoyed after the panel discussion has finished.

description.text:
Our regular monthly meeting this month will largely be about the gender pay gap, in preparation for equal pay day in November. Come and help us plan some activities around this and get involved in discussion about the topic.
As always, no need to have been before, no prior knowledge required and everyone welcome. Drop us an email in advance if you have any questions!

name.text: Fawcett East London Summer Fundraising Quiz
name.html: Fawcett East London Summer Fundraising Quiz

description.text:
We're hosting a fun-packed quiz to raise money for the Fawcett Society, to help support their independent, evidenced-based research and campaigns - all in the name of gender equality!
We've got some fantastic questions prepped and there will be spot prizes throughout the night, as well as a raffle - so what are you waiting for, get your tickets now!
Teams can be up to six but if you come solo we'll be sure to match you up on the night. Quiz starts at 7.30pm but come down from 6.30pm to register, have some food/drink and chat to us.
Good luck!

description.text:
We're delighted that we are going be joined by the Red Box Project Tower Hamlets at this meeting. The Red Box Project quietly ensures that no young woman misses school because she has her period, and more information can be found here: http://redboxproject.org/
This will also be the launch of us becoming a donation point  so that from now on, if you're coming along, you can bring sanity products with you and we'll make sure they are distributed to schools in the borough.
Of course we'll also have the regular update from Fawcett HQ and recap all the wonderful events we've either had over the past month or have coming up.
Everyone is welcome and we encourage you to come along with ideas and help make the group a welcoming, effective and fun group for all.

name.text: Fawcett East London at At Last: Votes for Women
name.html: Fawcett East London at At Last: Votes for Women

description.text:
LSE's suffrage exhibition At Last! Votes for Women is open at LSE Library until 31 August. It features many items from Millicent Garrett Fawcett’s archive, along with material from other suffrage groups.
We're delighted to have been invited for a tour of the exhibition by Curator for Equality, Rights and Citizenship, Dr Gillian Murphy, who will also show us some extra highlights from the collection.
description.html:
LSE's suffrage exhibition At Last! Votes for Women is open at LSE Library until 31 August. It features many items from Millicent Garrett Fawcett’s archive, along with material from other suffrage groups.

We're delighted to have been invited for a tour of the exhibition by Curator for Equality, Rights and Citizenship, Dr Gillian Murphy, who will also show us some extra highlights from the collection.

events.summary: LSE's suffrage exhibition At Last! Votes for Women is open at LSE Library until 31 August. It features many items from Millicent Garrett Faw

description.text:
Future Fawcett is Fawcett's schools outreach program, launched at the beginning of 2018. They've devised a series of workshops, roughly about 60mins long, to engage young people aged between 14-18 years old, in the history of women's suffrage and the current state of women's rights in the UK.
We're delighted that they are running an additional training session for anyone interested in becoming a volunteer for the training. At this stage you just need to be able to commit to attending the training with the potential to co-run a workshop in a school over the next six months. It's sure to be a great session so do come along to find out more about the programme and get enthused about the future of feminism!

For more details on the programme, see the Future Fawcett website, or check our upcoming events page for more informaion on the session itself.

description.text:
Come and join our July meeting, we'll have the usual update on what's been happening and what's coming up as well as some work on our campaigns and events. We'll finish the meeting with a presentation on sex work - the legal side of things and arguments for and against different models - followed by time for discussion.
So, sign up today and come and meet us, everyone is welcome!

description.text:
If you want to find out more about what the Fawcett Society does, meet some lovely people and find out what we're doing specifically in East London, this is the meeting for you.
Totally free to attend but make sure you register by 29 April, and don't make plans for after the meeting if you want to join us in a nearby pub.

description.text:
Do you have an idea for a great event you'd like to see happen or a fun activity you'd like to get involved in?
In the centary year of the first wave of women's votes in the UK and the month of International Women's Day, we'll be looking forward and planning how we're going to be keeping the spirit of the women's suffrage campaigners alive. Come and help us decide what that means and what we want to do this year.
As part of Fawcett's national fundraising campaign, we've pledged to raise £1,000 by December to help support our research and campaigning, and we want to make it as fun as possible!
Come along with your ideas, your friends, your experience or just yourself. Absolutely everyone welcome. Cake and post it notes will be provided. 
Email us - fawcetteastldn@gmail.com - if you have any questions!

description.text:
Come to our first meeting of 2018 for a look back over a hundred years of women's suffrage in the UK and a look forward to what the East London Fawcett Group has coming up in 2018.
6th February is one hundred years to the day since the passing of the Representation of the People Act, which gave (some) women in the UK the right to vote. We'll discuss the centenary of women's suffrage and what we've got planned to help mark it over the coming year.

description.text:
The nights will have drawn in by now so come and cheer yourself up with an evening of feminism, fun and (if you feel like it) food and drink.
As well as the usual update on what we've been up to since the last meeting and what we're doing next, this month our discussion topic will be inspiration east enders.
Is there someone, contemporary or historical, who you think deserves a spotlight? Come along to the meeting and tell us about them!
Absolutely everyone welcome - you don't even need to agree with us!
Got any questions, a suggestion for something you'd like the group to get involved in or a future discussion topic? Email us at fawcetteastldn@gmail.com
See you soon!

description.text:
The East London Fawcett group is a space for anyone to come along, talk and listen about gender equality in East London and beyond. The group was relaunched in the summer and this will be the third meeting, everyone is welcome and we'd love to hear from you.
This month, as well as an update on what's been happening since the previous meeting we'll also think about and agree future actions, and for the first time we'll  have part of the meeting dedicated to a discussion topic.
The topic this month is, 'why would gender equality be better for everyone?'. This isn't a debating society but we'd love to hear a broad range of viewpoints on why gender equality would be better for all, or maybe why it wouldn't. So have a think about come along...
description.html:
The East London Fawcett group is a space for anyone to come along, talk and listen about gender equality in East London and beyond. The group was relaunched in the summer and this will be the third meeting, everyone is welcome and we'd love to hear from you.

This month, as well as an update on what's been happening since the previous meeting we'll also think about and agree future actions, and for the first time we'll  have part of the meeting dedicated to a discussion topic.

The topic this month is, 'why would gender equality be better for everyone?'. This isn't a debating society but we'd love to hear a broad range of viewpoints on why gender equality would be better for all, or maybe why it wouldn't. So have a think about come along...

description.text:
Come and join the East London Fawcett Group for our second meeting, where we'll be talking about the Future Fawcett project (https://www.fawcettsociety.org.uk/future-fawcett) and what we can do to support and get involved. We'll also talk about other ideas for what we want to do as a group and have a think about venues for out upcoming meetings.
If you've got any questions email us at fawcetteastldn@gmail.com, or if you can't make this date but fancy coming along in the future, make a note of our upcoming dates: 05 September, 03 October, 07 November and 05 December - keep an eye on eventbrite for links.

description.text:
Come and join the first meeting of the relaunched East London Fawcett Group!
The group is being re-established and will meet once a month to:


Be a space for feminists in East London to get together, share experiences and learn from one another, hatch plans and have fun.


Plan and take action to progress the Fawcett Society's national campaigns and support them through local actions.


Everyone is welcome, and if there's anything we can do to make the group more accommodating let us know!
If you can’t make this month’s meeting keep your eye on our Twitter account (@eastfawcett) for the next date, or email us at fawcetteastldn@gmail.com with any queries.

Come and join the first meeting of the relaunched East London Fawcett Group!

The group is being re-established and will meet once a month to:

  • Be a space for feminists in East London to get together, share experiences and learn from one another, hatch plans and have fun.

  • Plan and take action to progress the Fawcett Society's national campaigns and support them through local actions.

Everyone is welcome, and if there's anything we can do to make the group more accommodating let us know!

If you can’t make this month’s meeting keep your eye on our Twitter account (@eastfawcett) for the next date, or email us at fawcetteastldn@gmail.com with any queries.
